Title: Disrupting an attacker's stability - Kuzushi
Description: Unbalancing or breaking an opponent's balance. It is a fundamental principle that is essential for executing effective techniques in Aikido.

Title: Evading the offensive line - Tai Sabaki
Description: Evading, redirecting, or blending with an opponent's attack through efficient body movement

Title: Shomen Uchi - Front Strike
Description: Shomen Uchi is a common Aikido attack technique and refers to a frontal strike to the head or face. The word "shomen" can be translated as "front" or "forehead," and "uchi" means "strike" or "attack." In Shomen Uchi, the attacker uses a downward striking motion with an open hand or a bokken (wooden sword) aimed at the top of the defender's head or forehead.

Title: Techniques
Description: Wide range of movements and strategies that are used to neutralize and redirect an opponent's energy.

Title: Yokomen Uchi - Side Strike
Description: Yokomen Uchi is another common Aikido attack technique and refers to a diagonal strike to the side of the head. The word "yokomen" can be translated as "side of the head," and "uchi" means "strike" or "attack." In Yokomen Uchi, the attacker uses a diagonal motion to strike the defender's temple or the side of the head.

Title: Nikyo - Second Principle
Description: Nikyo is a joint lock technique used in Aikido and various other martial arts. The word "Nikyo" can be translated as "second principle" or "second teaching," indicating its significance in Aikido's curriculum. Nikyo targets one of the opponent's wrists and applies pressure to control and immobilize them through the manipulation of their wrist joint.
